meanings.sent1: The milk is spoilable if left out too long.
meanings.sent2: It's important to refrigerate spoilable foods to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a spoilable disaster when the ants invaded the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was as spoilable as a delicate fruit, easily bruised.
meanings.sent5: The fragile flowers were spoilable in the hot sun, wilting quickly.

meanings.sent1: Fruits and vegetables are spoilable if not stored properly.
meanings.sent2: The spoilable meat had to be thrown away after being left out overnight.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was almost spoilable, but luckily the guest of honor was clueless.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as spoilable as a carton of milk, turning sour at the slightest inconvenience.
meanings.sent5: The delicate fabric was spoilable in the rain, losing its color and shape.
